IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: ATTACHMENTS: 1) NCIC/Meters Printouts 2) MGUN Center Report 3) Case Paperwork COMPLAINANT/VICTIM: 1) James Leroy Butler JR W/M 02/24/1978 14201 Cedarwood Dr Apt 11A Cumberland, MD 21502 PH# 240-362-1166 SUSPECT: 1) Amanda Marie Luckett W/F 04/19/1981 1011 Grant St, Cumberland, MD 21502 SCENE PROCESSING: I examined the areas where the items were stolen from the victims residence. NEIGHBORHOOD CHECK: No neighborhood check was completed due to the nature/location of the incident. NARRATIVE: On 10/09/2023 at approximately 1705 hours, I was dispatched to 14201 Cedarwood Dr, Apt 11A, Cumberland, MD for a report of a theft. Upon my arrival, I made contact with the complainant/victim, James Leroy Butler JR. James Butler stated that he arrived home on 10/09/2023 at approximately 1530 hours. James Butler advised that after arriving home he noticed property of his missing from the residence. James Butler stated that a 9mm caliber Glock 26 handgun (SN-ZRF770) ($700) with a mounted light/laser device ($100), five Glock magazines full of 9mm ammunition ($200), approximately 1100 rounds of 22 caliber ammunition ($200), a gold ring containing a diamond stone and emerald stones ($1000) and several silver dollar/50 cent piece coins ($unk) were taken from his residence. James Butler stated he last observed the handgun/property in his residence prior to going to bed on 10/08/2023 at approximately 2300 hours. James Butler stated that on the evening of 10/06/2023, he picked up and brought to his residence and acquaintance of Amanda Marie Luckett W/F 04/19/1981. James Butler advised that Amanda Luckett stayed at his residence until the morning of 10/09/2023. James Butler stated that on the morning of 10/09/2023 he left his residence to go to work. James Butler advised that when he left the residence, Amanda Luckett remained at his residence. James Butler advised that no other persons were in his residence or have access to his residence. James Butler advised that after he arrived home and notice his property missing, he then contacted Amanda Luckett by Facebook messenger and questioned her about the missing property. James Butler stated that Amada Luckett did admit to taking the above-described property, but later redacted the messages on Facebook messenger. James Butler stated that he believes Amanda Luckett did steal his property based on the conversation he had with her and that she was the only person in his residence during the time frame his property was stolen. Based on the above information, I completed an application of charges for Amanda Luckett and an arrest warrant (D230117904) was Issued for Amanda Luckett. I request this case remain OPEN pending Amanda Luckett being served her arrest warrant. All events occurred in Allegany County, Maryland. CASE OPEN.

IncidentProperty.Description: Glock G26 Gen4 Pistol with a mounted TLR-6 Streamlight light/Laser combination device and five loaded Glock magazines with 9mm ammunition.
24K Gold ring with Genie face and diamond in center with emerald stones as the genie's eyes.
Silver Dollar Coins, Fifty Cent Peice Coins. Unknown amount.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Narrative: On 10/13/23 the Allegany Co. Warrant Task Force received information that the suspect, Amanda Luckett was staying at the Best Western Hotel, National Hwy., LaVale MD.. Contact was made with the hotel staff and it was verified she was staying in Room 122 at that location. We did respond to that location and made contact with suspect, Luckett in Room 122. Suspect, Luckett was then taken into custody without incident on Arrest Warrant # D230117904. At approx. 1101 hrs I advised suspect, Luckett of her Miranda Rights. She did agree to answer questions at that time. During the questioning she did admit to stealing the handgun. She advised that she did not have the handgun and had given it to a Michael Logsdon. She stated that she did try to get the handgun back to return it, but that Logsdon would not give it back to her. She did advise that she was willing to cooperate with the investigation and that she did have text on her phone between her and Logsdon reference the handgun. I then transported suspect, Luckett to MSP Bk C. I contacted Sgt. Willetts, C3I, to ascertain if an investigator would be willing to interview suspect, Luckett. Cpl. Couter did respond to the barrack and conducted and interview with her to gain more information. At the conclusion of the interview I did transport suspect, Luckett to ACDC Central Booking. The incident was captured on my Body Worn Camera. Case remains under investigation by ST. Fairbanks.

ATTACHMENTS: 1) CPD Incident. COMPLAINANT/VICTIM: 1) James Leroy Butler JR W/M 02/24/1978 14201 Cedarwood Dr Apt 11A Cumberland, MD 21502 PH# 240-362-1166 SUSPECT: 1) Amanda Marie Luckett W/F 04/19/1981 1011 Grant St, Cumberland, MD 21502 NARRATIVE: Amanda Luckett was served her arrest warrant on 10/13/2023 by M/Tpr Layton. On 10/23/2023, I was notified by Cumberland Police Department Officer, Cpl. D. Pirolozzi, of an incident involving Amanda Luckett (See attached CPD report C2023-25548). I was notified that Amanda Luckett was trying to pawn stolen property (Gold ring with Genie face and gold coins) belonging the victim, James Butler JR. Cpl. Pirolozzi stated that they were able to recover the property and the property was return to the victim, James Butler JR. Pawn check was completed on 11/06/2023 for the stolen Glock Handgun belonging to the victim, James Butler JR, with negative results. I request this case be CLOSED by arrest. All events occurred in Allegany County, Maryland. CASE CLOSED.

ATTACHMENTS: 1) CPD Incident. COMPLAINANT/VICTIM: 1) James Leroy Butler JR W/M 02/24/1978 14201 Cedarwood Dr Apt 11A Cumberland, MD 21502 PH# 240-362-1166 SUSPECT: 1) Amanda Marie Luckett W/F 04/19/1981 1011 Grant St, Cumberland, MD 21502 NARRATIVE: On 11/08/2023, the complainant/victim, James Butler JR, advised that he discovered that the suspect, Amanda Luckett, had also stolen a pocket watch of his.James Butler JR stated that this pocket watch was a wind up style watch, gold or gold in color, had a 6-8 inch chain with belt clasp and a wheat seed. I added this item to the property of this report. I request this case remain OPEN pending an attempt to contact Michael Logsdon in regards to the whereabouts of the stolen firearm. All events occurred in Allegany County, Maryland. CASE OPEN.

IncidentProperty.Description: Wind up style watch, gold or gold in color, had a 6-8 inch chain with belt clasp and a wheat seed.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: ACTION TAKEN: On 10/13/2023 I was requested by the Maryland State Police Cumberland Barrack to assist with an interview of a subject they had in custody. I was advised Amanda Luckett was arrested on an active arrest warrant for theft. I was advised that Luckett wished to provide information related to the theft. Upon arrival to the Cumberland Barrack, Luckett was escorted from the holding cell to the Barracks interview room. This interview was recorded on my agency issued body camera. The following information was obtained during the interview with Luckett; however, it is not a word for word transcription. Please refer to the recording for complete details. The recorded interview, which lasted fifty-five (55) minutes and thirty-one (31) seconds, is retained in the case file. I advised her the interview would be audibly and visually recorded and she agreed. Luckett was advised of her Miranda rights, using an MSP form 180 (advice of rights), and agreed to speak with me. I advised Luckett to explain to me what she wished to speak with me about. Luckett explained that she was staying at the victims, James Butlers residence, due to her having no other place to stay that night. Luckett advised Butler left for work the next morning and she began texting with Michael Logsdon about a firearm and other property that was in Butlers residence. Luckett stated that while texting with Logsdon, she described the firearm to him, and he stated he wanted the firearm. Luckett advised that Logsdon stated he would be able to compensate her for the firearm. Luckett told me she took the firearm and left Butlers residence. Luckett explained that she did not have a way to get to Logsdons residence, so she went to Frostburg and was still attempting to arrange a ride with Logsdon. Luckett stated she spent the rest of the day attempting to arrange a ride to Logsdons residence on Devore Street in Ellerslie, Maryland. Luckett told me that at around 2000 hours, she was picked up from the 7-11 in Frostburg and was taken to Logsdons residence on Devore Street. Luckett advised that Logsdon and his neighbor provided the ride from Frostburg to Ellerslie. Luckett advised once they arrived at Logsdons residence, she gave the gun to him. Luckett told me she stayed with Logsdon and his girlfriend that night and the next day she was able to get a ride to the Best Western, where she and her boyfriend were staying in a room. Luckett was arrested at the Best Western by Master Trooper Layton. Luckett explained that Butler called her mother the next day and told her that she stole items from his residence. Luckett advised she messaged Butler and told him she was sorry for what she did. Luckett stated that Butler told her if she brought him his belongings back that evening, he wouldnt press charges. Luckett advised she didnt have a ride to go to Butlers place that day. Luckett stated her mother contacted her and told her the police were looking for her and that she needed to return Butlers belongings. Luckett explained that she messaged Logsdon and asked him to give her the firearm back. Luckett advised that Logsdon acted as if he did not know what she was talking about. Luckett stated she tried to reason with him, saying that she was already in enough trouble, and that he asked her to get the firearm for him. Luckett told me that Logsdon did not message her back until the next day and told her that he did not have his phone with him. Luckett advised that Logsdon told her that the cops were at his house looking for her. Luckett explained that she continued to reason with Logsdon, and he eventually became upset with her, and told her that they were currently hiding in their house because the cops were looking for her. Luckett stated that Logsdon told her to come get the fucking thing. Luckett, at this point of the conversation, told me that this occurred at Logsdons girlfriend, Jessica Carrs residence. Luckett advised they lived on Devore Street, Ellerslie, Maryland. Luckett stated that Logsdons mother lives in Hyndman, Pennsylvania. I then went over the property that was reported stolen from Butlers residence. Luckett admitted to taking the reported items and stated they were in a bag. Luckett advised that she left the bag at Carrs and Logsdons residence the morning she left. Luckett added that Logsdon told her that the day the cops came to his residence, he removed all the stolen property from the residence. Luckett and I spoke about if there were narcotics in the residence. Luckett stated that Carr and Logsdon both use Meth. At approximately [20:31] into to recording, I recapped the story that Luckett told me, for clarification. While recapping the story, Luckett goes into detail about where the stolen items were when she found them. Luckett found the items in Butlers closet and they were in a bag. Luckett states she called a cab and went to Frostburg, where shes walking around trying to get a ride from Logsdon. Luckett says that eventually Logsdon and his neighbor, Adam Sturtz, came and picked her up from 7-11 and drove her to Logsdons residence. Luckett explains that once they arrive at Logsdons residence, he takes the firearm out of her bag and starts to play with the laser sight. Luckett tells me thats the last time she saw the firearm. I then asked Luckett what she received in return for the firearm. Luckett told me she received nothing from Logsdon for the firearm. Luckett advised she was supposed to receive money in exchange for the firearm, due to Logsdon being able to sell the firearm. Luckett explained that she left the draw stringed Under Armor backpack that contained the rest of the stolen items at Logsdons residence. Luckett stated she left the backpack in the middle bedroom of the residence. Luckett advised she then left the next morning to go meet up with her boyfriend, leaving the backpack containing the stolen items. Luckett and I then spoke about the messages she has on her cellular device between her and Logsdon. I then presented Luckett with an MSP form 78 (Consent to Search and Seize). I then read her the form and she consented to let me read and capture digital photographs of the conversations. These digital photographs were uploaded to the case file on Google Drive for further review. The interview was then ended. Due to the information about the location of the firearm, and Luckett being uncertain if the firearm was still at Logsdons residence or his mothers residence in Pennsylvania, no further action was taken at this time. Since Luckett has already been charged with the theft, this concludes my involvement with this case. Case remains open, pending S/T Fairbanks review.

ATTACHMENTS: None COMPLAINANT/VICTIM: 1) James Leroy Butler JR W/M 02/24/1978 14201 Cedarwood Dr Apt 11A Cumberland, MD 21502 PH# 240-362-1166 SUSPECT: 1) Amanda Marie Luckett W/F 04/19/1981 1011 Grant St, Cumberland, MD 21502 NARRATIVE: I request this case remain OPEN pending an attempt to contact Michael Logsdon in regards to the whereabouts of the stolen firearm. All events occurred in Allegany County, Maryland. CASE OPEN.

ATTACHMENTS: None COMPLAINANT/VICTIM: 1) James Leroy Butler JR W/M 02/24/1978 14201 Cedarwood Dr Apt 11A Cumberland, MD 21502 PH# 240-362-1166 SUSPECT: 1) Amanda Marie Luckett W/F 04/19/1981 1011 Grant St, Cumberland, MD 21502 NARRATIVE: On 12/15/2023, I attempted to contact Michael Logsdon at multiple addresses in Maryland he has been known to be. I first responded to12506 Apts AB Suder Lane in Corriganville, MD. This is an address that Michael Logsdon otherwise is known toreside/stay/or frequent.Upon contact with the resident of apartment A, advised thatMichael Logsdon does not reside there and advised thatMichael Logsdon does not reside at the apartment B side either. I attempted to contact at the apartment B side, but received no answer at the door. I then responded to 10015 Devore St Apts AB in Ellerslie, MD. This is an address mentioned by Amanda Luckett and otherwise known that Michael Logsdon resides/stays/or frequents at. I received no response from inside the residence upon knocking on both doors. Based on my observations and information provided by a neighbor, this address appeared to be vacated and with no residents. I then responded to 14526 McMullen Hwy in Cresaptown, MD. This is an address for a girlfriend of Michael Logsdon. I received no response while at this residence. I request this case remain OPEN pending further attempts to contact Michael Logsdon. All events occurred in Allegany County, Maryland. CASE OPEN.
